intro: Hedychium raoi, commonly known as the Nilgiri ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive red and yellow spadix. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, Hedychium raoi is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
